Description: Sinclair Oil Corp. agreed to pay a $2.45 million civil penalty and spend more than $72 million for new and upgraded pollution controls to reduce air pollution from the company's three refineries in Casper and Sinclair, Wyo., and in Tulsa, Okla.
Agency: Justice Department Environment and Natural Resources Division
Info Source: http://www.usdoj.gov/opa/pr/2008/January/08_enrd_028.html

Description: The Department of Justice and the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency announced a settlement with two subsidiaries of Sinclair Oil Corporation to resolve alleged violations of air pollution limits established in a 2008 consent decree at refineries in Casper and Sinclair, Wyo. Sinclair Casper Refining Co. and Sinclair Wyoming Refining Co. were to pay stipulated penalties totaling $3,844,000 and spend approximately $10.5 million on additional pollution control equipment and other projects to resolve the allegations. The settlement also required the Sinclair companies to reduce emissions of nitrogen oxides (NOx), sulfur dioxide (SO2) and particulate matter by approximately 24,385 and 59 tons per year, respectively.
Agency: Environmental Protection Agency referral to the Justice Department
Info Source: http://www.justice.gov/opa/pr/sinclair-oil-pay-38-million-penalty-and-install-pollution-controls-wyoming-refineries-resolve

Description: The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency announced a Clean Air Act settlement in which the Sinclair Wyoming Refining Company (Sinclair) has agreed to pay a $378,000 penalty, update process equipment operating procedures, perform required training to workers, improve maintenance of equipment and perform integrity tests on pressure vessels and piping that will reduce the possibility of an accidental release of hazardous chemicals at their refinery in Sinclair, Wyoming.
Info Source: https://archive.epa.gov/epapages/newsroom_archive/newsreleases/5360abdc120ee5f885257a9400539a83.html
Notes: Note: This penalty is a duplicate of an amount shown in another record (either because it applies to a multi-location settlement or because Violation Tracker contains an agency record and a settlement announcement for the same case).

Info Source: Extracted from a download of OSHA's Enforcment Data downloaded on 3/02/2022, available at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_catalogs.php

Description: Sinclair Oil agreed to pay $2.45 million to Oklahoma, Wyoming and the federal government to resolve Clean Air Act violations. This was part of a larger $74 million settlement announced by the Justice Department; see the Violation Tracker entry at https://violationtracker.goodjobsfirst.org/violation-tracker/-sinclair-oil-corp
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/archive/opa/pr/2008/January/08_enrd_028.html

Agency: Environmental Protection Agency referral to the Justice Department
Info Source: https://www.epa.gov/newsreleases/sinclair-oil-pay-16-million-penalty-and-install-additional-pollution-controls-sinclair

Description: Sinclair Wyoming Refining Co. agreed to pay a penalty of $850,000 in settlement of allegations it illegally discharged pollutants, failed to remedy malfunctions, and caused harm to wildlife.

Description: Sinclair Wyoming Refining Co. agreed to pay a penalty of $660,000 in settlement of allegations it failed to properly respond to releases of hazardous waste and discarded the materials improperly.

Description: Sinclair Wyoming Refining Co. agreed to pay a penalty of $220,500 in settlement of allegations it failed to properly control and monitor the concentration of benzene in effluent.
Info Source: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1WW9pczeVkRDaUt6kkuY4TrGcgsDfOFuM/view
Notes: Penalty includes a $44,100 supplemental environmental project
